message.content:
{"id": "132786", 
"title": "Bug 132786: Value2 should be cleaned after converting operator from between to equal in highlight rule", 
"description": "When setting a highlight rule where the condition is '2 between 1 and 3' with the color blue, the value2 is not getting cleaned after converting the operator from between to equal. ", 
"OB": "Upon saving the report and inspecting the generated xml source, the expected result is that value2 should be cleaned in the highlight expression. ", 
"EB": "However, in the actual result, when checking the xml source, value1 is set to 1 and value2 is set to 3. ", 
"SR": "To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:\n1. Insert a data.\n2. Set a highlight rule in the Property Editor.\n3. Save the report.\n4. Modify the highlight rule by changing it to '1 equal 1' with the color blue.\n5. Check the behavior."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '132786', 'title': 'Bug 132786Value2 should be cleaned after convert operator from between to equal in highlight rule.', 'description': '2 between 1 and 3, color blue.3. ', 'OB': 'Save the report, see generated xml source.Expected result:In xml source, value2 should be cleaned in highlight expression.Actual result:In xml source, value1 is 1 and value2 is 3. ', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'Insert a data.2. Set highlight rule in Property Editor. Save the report4. Modify highlight rule, change to 1 equal 1, color blue.5. '}
